description.narrative: The projects overall objective is to mobilise youths energy, mobility, open-mindedness and dynamism as a potential positive force of countering violent extremist influences and narratives in the target communities affected by radicalisation.

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative:
Output 1.3 In Tajikistan youth-focused initiatives implemented 1.3.1 Number of youth-led needs assessment reports for targeted localities - 8 1.3.2 Number of local youth involved in regional policy dialogues and local development planning - 300 1.3.3 Number of youth-focused social infrastructure initiatives implemented - 0 1.3.4 Number of potential young migrants made aware of VE-related risk - 1000 1.3.5 Number of young people who benefited from a rehabilitation initiative supported by the project - 30
Output 2.3 Job and income opportunities for at least 700 young people in selected districts with high risks of radicalisation in Tajikistan enhanced. 2.3.1 Number of youth-at-risk with enhanced employment-related risks - 100 2.3.2 Number of youth with enhanced entrepreneurial skills - 20 2.3.3 Number of youth involved into apprenticeship programme - 20 2.3.4 Number of jobs created though small grants programme - 20

Output 1.3: In Tajikistan youth-focused initiatives implemented benefiting at least 3,000 young people 1.3.1 Number of youth-led needs assessment reports for targeted localities -0 1.3.2 Number of local youth involved in regional policy dialogues and local development planning - 300 1.3.3 Number of youth-focused social infrastructure initiatives implemented - 4 1.3.4 Number of potential young migrants made aware of VE-related risk - 1000 1.3.5 Number of young people who benefited from a rehabilitation initiative supported by the project - 50
Output 2.3 Job and income opportunities for at least 700 young people in selected districts with high risks of radicalisation in Tajikistan enhanced 2.3.1 Number of youth-at-risk with enhanced employment-related risks - 100 2.3.2 Number of youth with enhanced entrepreneurial skills - 30 2.3.3 Number of youth involved into apprenticeship programme - 25 2.3.4 Number of jobs created though small grants programme - 30

Major achievements under Output 1.3:
 Youth Action Plans for Qubodiyon, Shahrituz, Spitamen districts have been developed and approved by the district authorities.  2 mini-sport yards in Kulyab and Balkhi districts constructed and transferred for exploitation for young people.  Local football tournament for 202 boys and volleyball competition for 62 girls aged 18-35 organized and conducted covering in Spitamen, Kulyab, Balkhi and Farkhor districts.  Activity on strengthening capacity of adolescents in conflict with law through improvement of conditions in the workshop for welding works at the specialized vocational and technical lyceum of the Ministry of Labor, Migration and Employment of the Republic of Tajikistan. More than 70 young people in conflict with law were covered under this intervention.
Major achievements under Output 2.3:
 UNDP partnered with the Adult Education Centre under the Ministry of Labour, Employment and Migration a vocational training provided to 79 young people in target areas.  24 young people participated in business development trainings in all project target districts.  100 young people have been involved in the apprenticeship programme in all target districts.  7 public organizations from target districts were granted to implement projects, which provide employment opportunities with involvement of young people in vulnerable communities.  183 young people got employment (115 - through grant programs and 67 - after the completion of vocational courses.

Youth-focused initiatives implemented benefiting at least 3,000 young people 1.3.1 Number of youth-led needs assessment reports for targeted localities - 0 1.3.2 Number of local youth involved in regional policy dialogues and local development planning - 300 1.3.3 Number of youth-focused social infrastructure initiatives implemented - 4 1.3.4 Number of potential young migrants made aware of VE-related risk - 1000 1.3.5 Number of young people who benefited from a rehabilitation initiative supported by the project – 70
Job and income opportunities for at least 700 young people in selected districts with high risks of radicalisation in Tajikistan enhanced.
2.3.1 Number of youth-at-risk with enhanced employment-related risks - 300 2.3.2 Number of youth with enhanced entrepreneurial skills - 50 2.3.3 Number of youth involved into apprenticeship programme - 30 2.3.4 Number of jobs created though small grants programme - 50

Major achievements under Output 1.3: • The focus group discussions (FGDs) were conducted covering the total of 612 community members (236 women and 376 men (38.5% and 61% respectively) and youth focused priorities were identified. • The Youth Action Plans for Farkhor, Vahdat, Isfara, Balkhi, Vakhsh, Vanj, Rudaki and Khujand city have been developed and approved by the district authorities. • 5 mini-sport yards in Spitamen, Vakhdat, Qubodiyon and Nurabad districts constructed and transferred for potential exploitation by over 71, 000 people (48% are females). • The rehabilitation of Youth Centre in Shaartuz has been completed and equipped for engaging youth from 6 Jamoats (47,622 young men and 20,055 young women) of Shaartuz district. • Over 100 young people were engaged in sports activities such as a football tournament and a volleyball competition in 2 villages of Spitamen district to overcome social exclusion and isolation and enhance peers exchange. • 39 articles, 6 infographics and 1 booklet have been posted in top visited web-page of Tajikistan www.news.tj and 4 newspaper articles published by AsiaPlus local media group regarding project implementation. • The Project in partnership with State Agency TV Safina, produced 2 animated video and aired 4 TV surveys on the existing community security risks.
Major achievements under Output 2.3: • Under the Letter of Agreement (LoA) with the Adult Education Centre under the Ministry of Labour, Employment and Migration vocational training provided to 281 young men and 146 women (52%) in target areas. • 188 young people including 59 (31%) women and girls participated in business development trainings in all project target districts. • 410 people including 249 women (60%) women and girls participated in master-classes, vocational trainings and study tours in Spitamen, Nurabad, Vanj, Kulyab, Isfara, Balkhi, Vakhsh districts and Khujand city. • Green house for young farmers in Kulyab city constructed and employed 6 people including 4 women and can employ 10 women seasonally. • 5 public organizations from target districts were granted to implement projects with young people in vulnerable communities with further employment opportunities. • International Youth Forum “Ways to Achieve Professional Success” was conducted on May 3, 2019 with participation of more than 3000 young people, as well as representatives of government agencies, private sector, etc. • 35 active young activists from 8 districts of Tajikistan participated and built their capacity on entrepreneurship during the youth summer camp held 31 July – 4 August 2019 in Nurek district.
n/a, all project activities were completed in 2020
n/a, all project activities were completed in 2020
